edu.illinois.masalzr2.gui

Class Settings

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.illinois.masalzr2.gui.Settings
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener

    public class Settings
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener
    A (hopefully) intuitive GUI meant for players to define their game rules and settings. Also provides a series of links for further help. Developers should look to this GUI for a GitHub link, instruction guide on how to make textures, and where to then import those textures
    Author:
    Miguel Salazar

    • Constructor Detail

      • Settings

        public Settings(javax.swing.JFrame p,
                boolean lt,
                int tl)
        Defines some primitive settings and sets the reference JFrame
        Parameters:
        p - JFrame parent. The reference point for the JDialog
        lt - short for limitedTurns, boolean defining if the game has a turn cap for a shorter game or not
        tl - short for turnsLimited, int value defining the number of turns the game is limited to. This number is ignored when limitedTurns is false

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Packs, formats, and shows the JDialog

      • isTurnsLimited

        public boolean isTurnsLimited()
        Returns the selected status directly from the checkbox
        Returns:
        boolean - true if the game has a turn limit, false if the game can go on indefinitely

      • getTurnLimit

        public int getTurnLimit()
        Returns the turn cap defined by the Spinner model. This value will be ignored/unused by the game if the game is not capping turns
        Returns:
        int - number of turns given to each player

      • getCurrency

        public java.lang.String getCurrency()
        The currency symbol to be used throughout the game. Gotten directly from the JComboBox
        Returns:
        String - the currency symbol

      • isFancyMoveEnabled

        public boolean isFancyMoveEnabled()
        Gotten directly from the checkbox, enables or disables the fancy move.
        Returns:
        true if pieces move one game tile at a time, false if they just teleport to their location

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        This does something different for each component defined within the Dialog. The buttons are hopefully intuitive and obvious in what they do. The only two of note is the import which opens a JFileChooser in search of a json to import and the "Generate Json" button which... well... generates a json file and saves it to default texture folder under (home.dir)/textures/default as "defaultgmae.json"
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

      • valueChanged

        public void valueChanged(javax.swing.event.ListSelectionEvent e)
        Listens for changes to the selection in the bottom of the GUI. Immediately updates the texture but does not load the resources to memory
        Specified by:
        valueChanged in interface javax.swing.event.ListSelectionListener
